entry.title: Dataset of Guillemot et al. (2022) Small and slow is safe: on the drought tolerance of tropical tree species, Global Change Biology (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
entry.content:
Dataset of Guillemot et al. (2022) Small and slow is safe: on the drought tolerance of tropical tree species, Global Change Biology
Jan 6, 2022 - UMR Eco&Sols
Joannès Guillemot, 2022, "Dataset of Guillemot et al. (2022) Small and slow is safe: on the drought tolerance of tropical tree species, Global Change Biology", https://doi.org/10.18167/DVN1/HLBVJG, CIRAD Dataverse, V1
This dataset contains measurements of ten functional traits describing drought resistance, the fast-slow and stature-recruitment trade-off axes in 601 tropical woody species. Data were obtained from a screening of the literature, conducted in March 2021. The functional traits des...

entry.title: TRANSMAT n-Ary relations (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
entry.content:
TRANSMAT n-Ary relations
Jan 3, 2022 - UMR TETIS
LENTSCHAT, Martin, 2022, "TRANSMAT n-Ary relations", https://doi.org/10.18167/DVN1/1BBJBQ, CIRAD Dataverse, V1, UNF:6:xTM1cMCmnS2wfmB5Fr5slg== [fileUNF]
This dataset presents a Gold Standard of data annotated on documents from the Science Direct website. The relations are related to permeability n-Ary relations, as defined in the TRANSMAT Ontology (https://ico.iate.inra.fr/atWeb/, https://doi.org/10.15454/NK24ID, http://agroporta...

entry.title: Raw data for Andriamihaja et al (in review). Integrative taxonomy and phylogeny of leafless Vanilla orchids from the South West Indian ocean region reveal two new Malagasy species (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
entry.content:
Raw data for Andriamihaja et al (in review). Integrative taxonomy and phylogeny of leafless Vanilla orchids from the South West Indian ocean region reveal two new Malagasy species
Dec 16, 2021 - UMR PVBMT
Andriamihaja, F. Cathucia; Botomanga, Alemao; Misandeau, Chantal; Ramarosandratana, Aro V.; Grisoni, Michel; Da Silva, Denis; Pailler, Thierry; Jeannoda, Vololoniaina H.; Besse, Pascale, 2021, "Raw data for Andriamihaja et al (in review). Integrative taxonomy and phylogeny of leafless Vanilla orchids from the South West Indian ocean region reveal two new Malagasy species", https://doi.org/10.18167/DVN1/3OFMLH, CIRAD Dataverse, V1, UNF:6:RbhkaYeCRisqJ5oOXysPxg== [fileUNF]
Genotyping data from 7 microsatellite loci of 49 samples of leafless Vanilla species used in the paper "Integrative taxonomy and phylogeny of leafless Vanilla orchids from the South West Indian ocean region reveal two new Malagasy species" (in review).

entry.title: Data for: "The Dark side of shade: How microclimates drive the epidemiological mechanisms of coffee berry disease" (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
entry.content:
Data for: "The Dark side of shade: How microclimates drive the epidemiological mechanisms of coffee berry disease"
Dec 16, 2021 - UPR Bioagresseurs
Motisi, Natacha; Papaïx, Julien; Poggi, Sylvain, 2021, "Data for: "The Dark side of shade: How microclimates drive the epidemiological mechanisms of coffee berry disease"", https://doi.org/10.18167/DVN1/KP76RE, CIRAD Dataverse, V1
Data of coffee berry disease (CBD) dynamics and of microclimates, collected over two consecutive years (2012-2013) on a smallholding coffee farm in Bamendjou in West Cameroon (5°24′0″N; 10°19′0″E, alt. 1600m), were used to assess the effect of shade and full sun on CBD epidemiolo...

entry.title: Dexi model for: "Improved forecasting of coffee leaf rust by qualitative modeling: design and expert validation of the ExpeRoya model" (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
entry.content:

Dec 16, 2021 - UPR Bioagresseurs
Motisi, Natacha; Bommel, Pierre; Leclerc, Grégoire; Robin, Marie-Hélène; Aubertot, Jean-Noël; Arias Butron, Andrea; Merle, Isabelle; Treminio, Edwin; Avelino, Jacques, 2021, "Dexi model for: "Improved forecasting of coffee leaf rust by qualitative modeling: design and expert validation of the ExpeRoya model"", https://doi.org/10.18167/DVN1/LSYFJR, CIRAD Dataverse, V1
Dexi version of ExpeRoya model. The model structure is a tree that aggregates variables in a hierarchical way according to available knowledge on coffee leaf rust (CLR) and coffea arabica (the host) dynamics. ExpeRoya integrates 229 multiple interactions that exist within the CLR...

This database contains nine land use / land cover datasets collected in a standardized manner between 2013 and 2021 in seven tropical countries within the framework of the international JECAM initiative: Burkina Faso (Koumbia), Madagascar (Antsirabe), Brazil (São Paulo and Tocant...

entry.title: Winter on the slopes of Mont-Ventoux (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
ROULER

Winter on the slopes of Mont-Ventoux On a bike, ascending the Ventoux from the Malaucène side is a classic route, but the experience is a little more unique on skis.

entry.title: Ride of the Month: December. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: December. In Provence, Christmas lasts 40 days. Starting on the day of Sainte-Barbe, on the 4th of December, and lasting until Candlemas day on February the 3rd. In the small village of Luceram, nativity scenes have become a sacred tradition for its inhabitants.

entry.title: Caravan: Alba de Silvestro (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Caravan: Alba de Silvestro For me there’s only one difference between cycling and skimo, it’s just the season. One is for winter and the other is for summer.

entry.title: Exploring the Morvan. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
ROULER

Exploring the Morvan. The Morvan isn’t easily explained. A mountainous massif lying in the centre of the undulating Burgandy region. Travelling here is like taking a step back in time, and for those who love cycling, it’s a rich treasure trove waiting to be discovered.

entry.title: Sarah Bacher: Tackling Kühtai, a Tyrolian wonder. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Sarah Bacher: Tackling Kühtai, a Tyrolian wonder. Snow has just started to whiten the top of Kühtai - a mountain which holds a special place in my heart and the perfect location for a pre-ski season climb.

entry.title: Cycling & Creativity. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA VIE

Cycling & Creativity. Exploring how cycling can unlock creative thinking. With Stanford University's & University Côte d’Azur's research, pedal power has a whole new meaning.

entry.title: Ride of the Month: November. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: November. A ride that goes further than the normal nourishing experience, climbing the iconic Col d’Eze en route to Monaco in search of a model turned urban gardener. The principality isn’t classicly urban and certainly not suburban but it is on the rooftops of Monaco that Jessica grows her organic produce.

entry.title: Norway on Film AW21 (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
COLLECTIONS

Norway on Film AW21 The road may be long, the terrain may be tough but the results are spectacular. Shot the old fashioned way for a place where time stands still.

entry.title: A Mont-Blanc Gravel Tour with Etienne Hubert. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

A Mont-Blanc Gravel Tour with Etienne Hubert. After the last few months of training and the Olympics in Japan, I find myself constantly craving nature. I’ve thought about doing a Gravel tour of Mont Blanc for so long, so this seemed like the perfect time.

entry.title: Atelier Lookbook AW21. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
COLLECTIONS

Atelier Lookbook AW21. Uniquely styled, the collection mirrors the freedom of the road within the design and development process itself. Fewer rules, less restriction, more freedom.

entry.title: I am not a number 38. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
FILMS

I am not a number 38. As an Olympic sailor, Haffi understands the pressure that comes with competing at the highest level but for him, nothing compares to the intensity of racing on two wheels.

entry.title: AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
COLLECTIONS

AW21: Serre Chevalier Lookbook Outdoors is out there. Before and after the bike, between and among the hills. New Arrière-Pays pieces for AW21 inspired by the back country around Nice.

entry.content:
Film: Cycle of Ancestry

“Cycle of Ancestry" is a film about Mario Ordoñez-Calderón, a first-generation Mayan American who bikepacks 1,500 miles through the Yucatan Peninsula to explore his cultural heritage and learn about how your roots can shape your future.

entry.title: Film: Tears of Joy - Pachamama at Unbound Gravel (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
entry.content:
Film: Tears of Joy - Pachamama at Unbound Gravel

At this point, most people know the lasting impression that gravel cycling has. Under a gravel mindset, we seek to have fun, discover new and incredible places, lose ourselves and find ourselves. But is there a place for pure competition in this very experiential and burgeoning discipline? The folks of Emporia show us that there is, and teach us how to blend gravel around a local community.

Read More
VideosDave MalwitzOctober 21, 2021orbea 0 Comments

entry.content:

Jason Rowland shares his long-term impressions on the latest gravel cycling gear from Redshift Sports. This story includes a Redshift Kitchen Sink Handlebar Review, a Redshift Really Long Bar Tape Review, and a ShockStop Stem Review by Jason, who tested the equipment on his OTSO Waheela C gravel bike while exploring the most demanding North American terrain from Alaska to Kansas.

entry.title: Film: The Great Escape - Bikepacking UK (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
entry.content:
Film: The Great Escape - Bikepacking UK

In this inspiring film presented by Knog, British Adventurer Aaron Rolph reimagines the popular Land's End to John o'Groats traverse across Great Britain (typically 1,400km in length). Taking anything but the shortest route, Rolph brings to life a lockdown daydream, bikepacking 2,700km from the Scilly Isles to the Northernmost point of the Shetland Islands.

Read More
VideosDave MalwitzOctober 12, 2021bikepacking, video, united kingdom 1 Comment
